data.meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.
data.sentence: The word صِرَاطٍ comes from the root ص ر ط and is associated with the meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word مُسْتَقِيمٍ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
data.sentence: The word أَهْدَى comes from the root ه د ي and is associated with the meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.

data.meanings: To walk, to go or go along, to go afoot/on foot, move from place to place, march/travel/trod/pace/step, to go on or continue in a course of action, to pass, to be current, move/be in motion, walk about.
data.sentence: The word يَمْشِي comes from the root م ش ي and is associated with the meanings: To walk, to go or go along, to go afoot/on foot, move from place to place, march/travel/trod/pace/step, to go on or continue in a course of action, to pass, to be current, move/be in motion, walk about.
The word أَفَمَنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From
The word أَمَّنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to face/encounter/confront, face, will, course/purpose/object one is pursuing, place/direction one is going/looking, way of a thing, consideration/regard.
data.sentence: The word وَجْهِهِ comes from the root و ج ه and is associated with the meanings: to face/encounter/confront, face, will, course/purpose/object one is pursuing, place/direction one is going/looking, way of a thing, consideration/regard.

data.meanings: to be worth, equivalent to. sawwa - to level, complete, arrange, make uniform, even, congruous, consistent in parts, fashion in a suitable manner, make adapted to the exigencies or requirements, perfect a thing, put a thing into a right or good state. istawa - to establish, become firm or firmly settled, turn to a thing, to direct one's attention to a thing, mount. ala sawain - on terms of equality, i.e. in such a manner that each party should know that it is free of its obligations, at par. sawiyyun  -even, right, sound in mind and body. sawiyyan - being in sound health.. sawwa (vb. 2) to proportion, fashion, perfect, level, equal, fill the space. sawa - midst.
data.sentence: The word سَوِيًّا comes from the root س و ي and is associated with the meanings: to be worth, equivalent to. sawwa - to level, complete, arrange, make uniform, even, congruous, consistent in parts, fashion in a suitable manner, make adapted to the exigencies or requirements, perfect a thing, put a thing into a right or good state. istawa - to establish, become firm or firmly settled, turn to a thing, to direct one's attention to a thing, mount. ala sawain - on terms of equality, i.e. in such a manner that each party should know that it is free of its obligations, at par. sawiyyun  -even, right, sound in mind and body. sawiyyan - being in sound health.. sawwa (vb. 2) to proportion, fashion, perfect, level, equal, fill the space. sawa - midst.

data.meanings: To invert, overthrow, throw one with the face to the ground, throw face downwards, prostrate anyone on (the face), he prostrated him, he bent his head towards the ground, to fall down, turn a thing upside down.Charge/onslaught/assault, in war.
data.sentence: The word مُكِبًّا comes from the root ك ب ب and is associated with the meanings: To invert, overthrow, throw one with the face to the ground, throw face downwards, prostrate anyone on (the face), he prostrated him, he bent his head towards the ground, to fall down, turn a thing upside down.Charge/onslaught/assault, in war.
